input_text:
Job Title: Federal Project Manager

Location: Bloomington, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job#: 2025595

Job Description:

Project Managers are seller-doers who develop and maintain client relationships. They will have the responsibility for coordinating and leading our design teams to deliver quality projects that make our clients successful. The ideal candidate for this position will have experience working on DOE, facility, laboratory, and federal campus infrastructure projects. Additional science and technology and/or federal agency experience including federally funded research and development centers (FFRDCs), GSA, and DOS a plus. They will manage construction administration activities and have experience with design-build projects. This Project Manager will be responsible for the successful completion of large and smaller value projects as part of an annual portfolio of projects. Additionally, this Project Manager will:

Plan, coordinate, communicate and facilitate activities of several disciplines on projects of all sizes from concept through completionMake critical decisions and recommendations that have an important effect on projects and programsManage project delivery, including scoping, budgeting, maintaining schedules, meeting budget objectives, communicating and meeting deadlinesPromote safe work environments.This person will serve as one of the primary interfaces with local clients.They will assist in maintaining client relationships and network within the client organization in supporting business development activities.They will assist with the development of technical and cost proposals and qualification statements.

Qualifications

Bachelors degree in Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management or related field from an accredited institutionMinimum 7 to 20 years related experience, including delivery of facilities and infrastructure projectsAbility to make thoughtful, informative and persuasive presentations to clients, regulatory agencies and the general publicExcellent written & verbal communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to obtain and maintain a DOE, GSA, DOS or DoD Security Clearance

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [email protected] or 844-463-6178 .

Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing速 in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work速 in the United Kingdom and Mexico.
